intro: Kielmeyera cataractae, commonly known as the Cataracta Kielmeyera, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features elliptical leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
